alert.note: Alert for Lumpkin; White (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 11:35PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lumpkin, Banks, White and Hall Counties through MIDNIGHT EST... At 1135 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Sautee to near Dougherty, and moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Dahlonega, Cleveland, Homer, Oakwood, Lula, Maysville, Clermont, Helen, Gillsville, Unicoi State Park, Robertstown, Pinefield Crossroads, Mossy Creek, Murrayville, Garland, Leaf, Smithgall Woods Conservation Are, Hollingsworth and Sautee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EST for north central and northeastern Georgia.
